I just realized you could make acrylic nails out of this  Step 1: grow out yo nails to desired length of what you want your acrylics to be  Step 2: put a good peel off base coat on you nails (one that comes off in on piece) Step 3: paint ten or so layers of whatever nail polish you want until desired thickness of acrylic nail  Step 4: peel off nail  Step 5: cut your real nails to normal length or at least shorter then the acrylic ones  Step 6: glue the acrylic nails back to you real nails and boom, you have mediocre floppy nails.

If u guys don't know how to cross out, bold or italicize here's how to    1. Bold to make something bold add * before and after what u want to make bold example *coconut*   2.Cross out to cross something out add - before and after every word u want to cross out example -coconut-   3.Italicize to italicize put _ before and after every word u want italicized example _coconut_   EDIT thanks for 2 likes *_-coconut-_*

I clicked the link for your cat's nail polish... I actually expected it to be those little rubber or silicone Kitty claws for people who don't want to declaw their cats but who's cats like to shred Furniture stuff like that they're actually really really cool if you've never seen them they are like fingernail polish gels for cats they come in mostly neon colors and they stay on for a couple weeks but they slip on over their claws  I had a cat who had fragile nails and she kept hurting herself and tearing them they would split all the way up and they would bleed and then they would be all tattered and painful the only thing she could think to do was to sharpen them or trying to fix them because cat logic  So the vet was trying to get me to declaw because he was worried about infection and her making it worse... and I just can't fathom cutting the tips of another animal fingers off at least not a creature that I theoretically like  Anyway I got a manicure kit and some super glue and sat down with my cat and I peaster Little paw nails together and covered them with Hello Kitty pink nails  She got spoiled rotten with her Kitty manicures  So much so and my friend was having trouble with his Kittens claw trims I brought my princess over I sat with my knees up where she would lean back like a little Kitty recliner and she would give me her Paw and let me do a couple nails and then pull her away until I gave her a treat and then she would give me back the paw.   His cats watch this with almost as much Fascination as people. And decided to give it a try. I wasn't giving them full gels I just was trimming their nails but after having their nails trimmed and getting treats for it they realized it was not a terrifying ordeal and they're grown ups learn how to do it...   In other news I also used to do my Rottweiler toes to be completely Frank I would dress up and do anybody's males that didn't run away from me oh wait I still do that luckily I work in costumes.   My grandmother taught me how to do fill's on acrylic nails when I was about 10. So she got me over every couple weeks and I do hers and her friends nails... Not a Bad Thing to teach a young girl was really popular in college, we had a spa night and I was able to bust out the acrylics and do everyone's nails...   And I do holographic hair as well ;)  I will make a DIY video on how to do that. I tie mine a little bit differently than most people... because I work at night clubs where you can't really see what you do I do a lot of it by feel and I also work on for children and so you have to be fast â™¡

I remember seeing articles talking about how polish mountain was the most "stupid form of nail art ever". I wanted to go to the publisher's house and "inform" said publisher (with my fist, of course) along with many other publishers of hateful comments that IT IS NOT A FORM OF NAIL ART. IT IS A CHALLENGE THAT YOUTUBERS DO TO ENTERTAIN THEIR VIEWERS. NO, THEY DO NOT ACTUALLY THINK THAT POLISH MOUNTAIN IS PRACTICAL, EITHER. Hopefully I have explained the matter to the next person who wants to write a hateful comment. Thank you for your time.
